text: William Mitchell College of Law was a private, independent law school. It was in St. Paul, Minnesota, United States, from 1956 to 2015. It offered full- and part-time legal education for those who wanted a Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree. On December 9, 2015, Hamline University School of Law merged into William Mitchell College of Law,Maura Lerner, "Hamline, William Mitchell law schools to merge ", Star Tribune (February 13, 2015). and became the Mitchell Hamline School of Law. ==References== Category:Colleges and universities in Minnesota
title: William Mitchell College of Law
